Negative Reviews: The check in process. We had to wait in a queue for about half an hour. The receptionist was lovely and very professional, but it just takes really long. Also, the parking situation is really not the best. When you arrive by car, there is nowhere to park until you receive your ticket to the parking lot. We stopped right in front of the hotel, where you are only supposed to stay for 10 mins. As the check in process was very long and we got blocked by two cars, we needed to wait until somebody else got checked in to be able to drive away which was way over the 10 mins. You need to figure out a better system for parking. Maybe ask guests to let you know in advance  if they needed parking, and send them electronic tickets, so they do not block each other at the entrance, when they arrive.

Review Title: The good points heavily outweigh the issues. I would happily go back.
Negative Reviews: The breakfast room - ample selection of food was ok though I tasted better in terms of food quality - not really a problem. What really bothered me was that the available space is too small for the amount of people the hotel can hold. Thank goodness it's acoustically treated and was manageable in terms of sound volume. Physically however, everybody is on top of each other and in everyone's way. Tables are much too close together (between 10 and 40 cm apart) for comfort. Hotel management please note - this is a 4-star hotel not a university canteen. I was at best uncomfortable and at worst feeling like I'm eating in a market place. I mostly left the breakfast room stressed out every time over my 4-day stay. This is not good at all considering that a good number of customers travel solely to relax. Please fix it - it's a real pity as everything else is so great.

Review Title: Very close to old Riga, and airport connections, and the hotel's facilities are fantastic!
Negative Reviews: The only issue was the noise. The front of the hotel faces a main road, tram line and railway bridge so you're going to have noise until around midnight when public transport ends. I think this will only affect rooms that have the river view though. Another issue would be too many kids; it's a spa, so you come to relax, last thing you want is kids running around the coridoors screaming when you've paid over 100 euro for your stay, but that's a problem that is caused by inconsiderate guests rather than the hotel. Neither of the issues have impacted my review too negatively though as I can't falut a hotel for its guests and location. Everything else about the stay was exceptional and I would definitly stay again and have recommended the hotel to friends.
Positive Reviews: The room was really nice, modern, spacious, and comfortable. We also had a river view. The spa is great you get access to the pool, jacuzzi, and 3 types of sauna. It's well worth 20 euro (guest price), so make sure you check that out! We are even considering going back monthly to the spa as non-guests. The breakfast is without a doubt one of the best I've had in a hotel in Latvia the closest I had in quality and variety was at a Hilton in the UK, so if you haven't got breakfast included you should add it. I would add that compared to most of the restaurants in Old Town the hotel's own restaurant is actually reasonably priced, so I would recommend eating there at least once as you won't find many options for the same quality and price in Old Riga.

Review Title: Experience with the Wellton Riverside SPA Hotel
Negative Reviews: I don't have any negative experiences. Perhaps, I would welcome a bigger discount for entering the SPA.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is located near the Old town, right next to the Daugava river. If you have a well-oriented room, it is possible to have a nice view of the river and the National library. Right next to the hotel is the Grƒìcinieku iela bus stop, where bus 22 runs, providing a direct connection to the airport (approximately 30 minutes). The central bus station is also quite nearby. The location of the hotel is very convenient. Just a few minutes by walking and you are in the Riga Old town. The breakfast was rich and excellent. I especially recommend trying the excellent cheese salad. An interesting fact is that during the week breakfast is served until 11:00 a.m. and on the weekend until 11:30 a.m. This is good news for people who like to sleep longer. I also recommend visiting the restaurant. Excellent food and drinks. By the way, near the hotel there is Ala Pagrabs Folkklubs, where you can try traditional Latvian food and beer. The hotel staff was very nice. The room was spacious and clean. I liked the bed very much. It is also possible to use the SPA center within the hotel. But that's for a fee. The SPA has two pools (normal and warmer water), one of them with jets, and three different saunas. The entrance fee for a hotel guest is 20 EUR for 1.5 hours. I definitely recommend visiting the lookout on the roof of the hotel. Overall I was very satisfied with the accommodation.
Breakfast cleanless facility

Positive Reviews: First of all, I'd like to express my gratitude to Inga, the receptionist we had the pleasure to meet. She was not only polite and helpful while assisting us upon check-in, but went an extra mile.. in fact a lot of extra miles. She practically organized the whole stay for us: advised on which walking tour to take, where and what to eat, where to get the best view on the city and even kindly recommended a mini organ concert in the Riga Cathedral which btw was astonishing! Besides this experience, we really enjoyed the size and style of our room, as well as the amenities in it (e.g: you can rarely find shoehorn and douche by the toilet in European hotels). Regarding breakfast, sparkling wine was a nice touch to it. The SPA facilities were also nice, loved the steam room after having walked the whole day in freezing winter temperature.

Review Title: Best sleep in the center of Riga
Negative Reviews:
Ideas for improvement:
Breakfast: maybe add some other type of bread, like bread rolls, or baguettes. There were only toasts. 
Spa: I think a hotel with the spa, should offer to their staying guests free dressing gown and spa towels. Regardless how low is the price, I would thought it should be part of the room benefits. 
Reception: we did our check-in online and nevertheless it took quite some time to do our check-in. Maybe something can be improved in the process. The staff, as said, is great, but probably one or two admin things could be done more efficiently
Positive Reviews:
The location of this hotel is perfect for anyone who arrives from the airport and wants to visit the city. It is right at the edge of the old city centre, which makes it a perfect spot to start your discovery. The room were spacious and comfortable. The bed was extremely comfortable, I slept like a baby. The Wi-Fi worked perfectly throughout the hotel. 
The breakfast was really good, what I thought was really a nice touch was the area where one could get freshly made pancakes, waffles or any type of eggs. Normally this would be just the "egg" area. Also, a glass of prosecco, what a nice start of the day. :) 
We took advantage of the spa, that has quite some facilities and all clean and well maintained. 
The whole staff of the hotel is ready to help and cater to any need of the guests.
Welcoming, good service, quiet place,.

Negative Reviews: Nothing! We'll be back! If ever in Rƒ´ga again we'll be sure to come back. We'll also recommend the Wellton Riverside to anyone visiting the stunning Latvian capital.
Positive Reviews: We had a great 3 nights at this hotel! We flew to Rƒ´ga from Edinburgh for only ¬£24 return! Our visit to the beautiful city was made even better by staying in a stunning hotel. We thought the Wellton Riverside was the best place we could have stayed in Rƒ´ga. The spa access was great and well worth the money to be included in our room price. Ieva at reception was so friendly and helpful, she helped us with recommendations of where to go in Rƒ´ga etc. as well as recommending a day trip to Sigulda and Gauja National Park which we thoroughly enjoyed (go!). Ieva's customer service skills are exemplary, she made us feel at home in the Wellton. We would also recommend doing the free alternative (Moscow district) walking tour which meets at St. Peter's Church at 12pm, it was great! A visit to the art nouveau district is also essential, as well as to the top floor of the National Library and the Radisson Blu Skyline bar for the best views in town! This hotel is also SO UNBELIEVABLY WELL LOCATED. It's also so clean, cleaners every corner you walk around. The location is perfect. Our room was lovely and we had a riverside view. Breakfast was basic but it was more than sufficient. All in, an excellent stay and we'd thoroughly recommend it.
Room Type: Riverside Room with Daily SPA access

The breakfast here is not the highest quality. Last time I ate there it gave me an impression of a canteen with influence from Soviet times. During recent stays I prefer eating elsewhere although its included.

- the shower is in the bathtub which is suboptimal and the water pressure is a bit low

Negative Reviews: Not staying long enough.
Positive Reviews:
First time in Latvia/Riga. Travelled with a friend. 

From the moment we arrived at the Wellton on the 17th Nov 21 @ 12:00, we were welcomed, by a lovely receptionist. She was very fast in checking us in as the rooms requested was not ready at the time, as the checking time was at 15:00pm.
She managed to actually free rooms for us fast and efficiently.
As i am a hotel manager in London, i felt this was amazing customer service.

Overall the rooms 504, 507 on the fifth floor were amazingly spacious and clean, not to mention the view to the riverside which was absolutely outstanding. I also noticed how the building was maintained and cleaned regularly. Hands down, one of the cleanest hotels we have visited.

The location was just perfect as it was close walking distance to local amenities. Shops, bars, restaurants, and shopping centres to name a few.

The Spa within the hotel was clean, luxurious and peaceful, 5* in my opinion and highly recommended to anyone visiting Riga.

Again, I would like to thank all the staff that made our stay an extraordinary experience a one to remember. We shall definitely be back in the near future.

From Shane & Mayz.

We really enjoyed our stay in Wellton Riverside! We booked a room for two with a view over the river Daugava, with fantastic breakfast and SPA access included. Note that you might need to book a particular time for your SPA visit (due to pandemics) - we didn't book in advance and got the last free spot the next morning after breakfast. 

The room was great and comfortable and very silent given that it's located on a super lively street. Breakfast was really good - a great selection of quality food. SPA was good - two kinds of saunas, nice pool, and a pretty big hot tub area. Also, don't forget to check out the 8th floor terrace and bar, it offers an amazing view overlooking the city of Riga!

Review Title: All is great except of parking
Negative Reviews:
- Parking is the biggest issue. They rent a few spaces in the underground parking of the nearby residential building. It‚Äôs good, but the only way to get in and out the parking is to call the reception and ask for a person to come and open it for you. It takes some time for the guy to come. Moreover several times no one picked up the phone so we had to go to the reception by foot, wait in line, ask, wait, go back to garage to park‚Ä¶ Weird thing. And it‚Äôs all for 15 euro per night. They also have another open parking (same price) a bit further from the hotel. But it‚Äôs sandy gravel (so the car gets dirty) and the guard there is not polite. Finally during our second stay there were no parking places available at all! So we had to park somewhere along the street.
- Breakfast is the same every day so if you stay more than a few days it gets somewhat boring.

Review Title: Hotel in Riga Old Town with super nice breakfast!
Negative Reviews: I was kinda expecting a little bit better view from my room. Especially considering the fact that it was a premium room, but what I got was a small window facing roof of a house across the street. So it was kinda disappointment.
Positive Reviews:
Location of the hotel is great! Riga Old Town is just around the hotel including the river. Lots of restaurants nearby and you can enjoy a nice walk by the river or in Old Town. Hotel provided me with parking spot in the garage for 20‚Ç¨/24h. You can probably find a cheaper parking spot near the hotel - I saw several guarded parking spots, while walking around in Old Town. Hotel room was spacious and really quiet. It was entirely in another building (not the main one), meaning it was more quiet.

Breakfast was really-really rich in variety. There were fresh pancakes, waffles, fried egg etc. Everyone finds there something to eat! There was even a gluten-free section of foods and sweets and the best part of course a class of champagne, hehe. Definitely worth the money!

The restaurant situation was really bad. The orders from the terrace were often ignored because staff was too busy. The waiter refused to give us a table because he was already stressed. He snapped at people claiming that it would take at least 1h to get something to eat. He gave us the impression that we should go away.

Room clean and comfortable.  Got housekeeping everyday even though I didn't put out the sign asking for it.  Good shower pressure.
Breakfast offered an extensive choice.  It was busy but plenty of tables.  Tables cleared very promptly - so promptly that I lost my coffee a couple of times when I went back to the food buffet. There was an outside seating area as well which looked very nice.

Negative Reviews:
My comment is directed more towards Booking.com than the hotel itself, as the hotel stay was satisfactory, albeit a bit pricey due to its proximity to the old city. Our experience began with booking a room with access to the spa, which we had arranged over the phone beforehand. However, just before our arrival, when we checked the booking app, it offered us an upgrade for an additional 1.80 euros. We thought, why not, for a better room at such a minimal cost. Notably, there was no indication that this upgrade would result in losing access to the spa.

Upon reaching the hotel, the receptionist informed us that our upgraded room did not include access to the spa. They explained that since the spa operates on a separate system, there was a possibility it might still show up as included. Hoping for the best, we proceeded to the spa, only to find out that our room did not include access, necessitating an additional payment of 40 euros.

During check-out, we requested to speak with the supervisor, Nadezda, who kindly investigated the matter. She clarified that our upgrade through Booking.com had indeed resulted in the loss of spa access. Although she sympathized with our situation, she could only provide printed receipts and advised us to contact Booking.com for a refund.

Following her advice, my husband reached out to Booking.com, only to receive a response stating that due to the upgrade, spa access was forfeited and no refund would be issued. This revelation left us quite surprised and disappointed. Our intention for the trip was to enjoy some quality time together, including spa relaxation, but instead, it turned into a frustrating episode where a seemingly insignificant room upgrade cost us significantly in spa fees.

Sharing our experience serves as a cautionary tale for others. In such cases, Booking.com seems quick to absolve itself of any responsibility, leaving customers to bear the consequences of insufficient information regarding upgrades. Our disappointment
Positive Reviews:
The hotel is conveniently located on the corner of the old town. If you're arriving by car, there's nearby parking available at Peldu lela 24-26, Centra rajons, Riga, LV-1050, priced at 15 euros for 24 hours. The attendant there speaks English, Russian, and Latvian, but only accepts cash payments; card payments are not accepted.

In terms of amenities, the room was well-equipped with toiletries, bottled water, slippers, a bathrobe, and a kettle‚Äîeverything you might need for a comfortable stay. However, there was a noticeable scent of chlorine from the spa when walking through the hallway.

It's worth noting that noise from outside and within the hotel can be quite loud. Those seeking a quieter environment may want to request a room suited for that purpose at the reception.

The spa, while not very large, is adequate for relaxation purposes. Additionally, the breakfast offered a wide variety of choices.

Overall, while some may find the hotel to be pricey, its proximity to the old town makes it a convenient choice for those wishing to explore the area.

Negative Reviews: I really didn't like the car parking. The hotel does not have parking lot, so the hotel staff instructs you to park your car in the nearby parking lot (15eur/day). everything would be fine, but after going to the parking, a very arrogant old man says that there are no free space. But then we observe a situation where Latvian citizens (not hotel guests) get a parking space because they pay the FULL price (without the hotel discount). Once again, we appeal to the guard of the parking lot saying "look, we see how a free place has appeared for a fully that person with full price". The man's answer was "there is no room for hotel guests - the parking lot is full". I understand that the parking may be full (although we counted at least 10 free places visually), but it is a very unpleasant fact that the supervisor behaves arrogantly like this in the center of Riga. I will add that the action takes place in the evening, it is raining, it is freezing, and we are with a small child. Unfortunately, the hotel staff could not help us by directing us where they would recommend parking the car in such a case. We had to drive around in an unknown city for more than an hour until we found a free place, 10 minutes away from the hotel. We are happy at least to the extent that the price of parking was not very expensive - it was 30 eur/day.

Negative Reviews: The spa was ok but not very cosy.
Positive Reviews: Fresh room that was big and comfy. Breakfast was way over expectations. Lots of options and fresh pancakes, waffles and other hot options. The hotel is just a 5 minute walk away from Old Town. Take the bus from the airport, it stops near from the hotel. Spa is also OK
They make special requests for my birthday and was nice ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Review Title: Modern comfortable hotel with lots of positives but some attention required in some key areas.
Negative Reviews:
Bit of an issue with frequency of room cleaning which resulted in us having to complain twice.  We ended up having to ask for clean towels and loo roll and putting our full bins outside our room to be emptied.  Reception rang us and offered us a bottle of ‚ÄòChampagne‚Äô to apologise but it was  v cheap fizzy sweet wine which they gave us.  Nice gesture on the surface but just annoyed us further tbh and we returned it. You can‚Äôt charge food or spa costs to your room so you need to always have your bank card with you.  People in other reviews have raved about breakfast- we thought it was quite average tbh, super busy and difficult to get a seat.   Also butter at the bread/toasting station is served from a communal jar so lots of people touching the wooden spreader - put us off having any so we didn‚Äôt enjoy toast. 
Lady in reception booked us a table in the medieval restaurant but when we turned up the restaurant was closed - turns out it‚Äôs been closed since the Covid pandemic. This flummoxed us. 
On our last night we ate from room service.   Vegetables were raw - weird and not enjoyable as a chicken accompaniment. 
No milk in room gif having with tea/coffee.
Positive Reviews:
Location perfect for walking everywhere we wanted to go.  Spa was enjoyable with nice treatments.  Our room overlooked the river which was really lovely - we enjoyed a glorious sunset view and.  Decent sized minibar fridge in the room and well stocked initially but not replenished. Hotel and room was very nicely decorated and bed comfortable - we had good sleeps.  One thing - the room was super warm so we had to open the window so a bit noisy from traffic.  This didn‚Äôt bother us but might others. 
Room had a bath with a shower above.   The water pressure was pretty good and water always hot. Good clothes storage space with adequate hangers and shelving.   Cases fit under the bed when opened out.

Review Title: Nice weekend stay, negatives can be easily improved
Negative Reviews:
At the checkin we spent 15 minutes standing in a line, we were told it is a regular situation on Fridays. to be fair all desks were working, but starting a relaxing weekend from standing in a line in front of the rotating door was not nice, a ticketing system would be a huge improvement.
Tap water smells of chlorine, there is no fee drinking water in the room provided by hotel, and the only option from a mini bar is 0,3 bottle for 2 EUR (there is 1 bottle per room). So it is best to have drinking water with you.
Positive Reviews: Great view from the riverside room, good SPA area, great breakfast.
Room Type: Riverside Room with Daily SPA access

Negative Reviews: prices for drinks
Positive Reviews: everythink

We stayed at the Wellton Riverside after being at the Wellton Spa Hotel in Riga (which we liked more). It is a nice hotel, a little outside the heart of the center and by the river. Our first room had a view to the river but had a leaking sink so we were moved to another room with a view to a neighboring building. Breakfast was great - waffles, egg chef, pancakes, porridge, fruits, and more. Nice breakfast room too, very green with plants and made to look larger due to mirror walls. Very cool. The hotel restaurant was pleasant and very comfortable with endearing staff.

I booked a room with a view to the river and was a bit worried about the noise that a busy street between the hotel and the river might cause, but sound isolation was good enough to cancel most of that noise.
The room itself was quite large, bright, with everything you might expect from a 4-star hotel.
Location is great, steps away from the old town.
The breakfast! The breakfast was amazing! Large selection, everything is fresh, eggs, pancakes and waffles are prepared right there in the breakfast hall. Everything I tried was tasty. Even coffee from the machine!
There were a couple of small hiccups during our stay, but staff solved everything promptly so I'm adding this as a plus.

Review Title: I wish I'd had the time to enjoy the Spa facilities... Might have to come here again!
Negative Reviews:
Well, it sounds worse than it is:
the car park is around the corner, about 50m down a side street. But to get to it, you have to drive around the one-way system of the old town. I over-shot the turning and lost 15 minutes trying to navigat back to the road that led into the old town. If you get it right, it's probably a 5 - 10 minute drive. Review Title: Nice stay, but photos should be more accurate
Negative Reviews: The photos on the website should be more accurate. I reserved a Standard Single Room and I got a room that was different from the photos. Don't get me wrong, the room was ok, but it was not what I was expecting, so it generated a bit of frustration in the beginning. If you see the photos of the Standard Single Room, it shows a room with a big window (city view or inner courtyard view) and then 2 bathroom options (with or without bathtub). I chose the one with a bathtub, expecting that the room would be the same for both bathroom options. However, the room was totally different, with a tiny window pointing to the sky and it was completely covered by snow, so I could not open or see anything, making the room a bit claustrophobic. The staff tried to help and they showed me other options, but none of the other options resembled the photos on the website. Anyways, it was still a good stay, but as a constructive feedback: more photos should be added to avoid misleadings.

On our last evening we wanted to eat again in the restaurant before we left to go to the airport. We had already ate in it and enjoyed it. However the service was very slow and when I got my meal the fish was raw and in fact freezing in the middle. I spoke to the waiter and he returned it to the kitchen to be properly cooked. After waiting 25 minutes the food had not come back nor had my husbands meal arrived. I asked the waiter to cancel the order and we would just pay for what we had recieved. At that moment my husbands steak appeared so he ate it but I explained that we were in a hurry to get a plane and there is no way it should have taken more than 25 mins to finish cooking the fish. The bill was brought to us and the cost of the fish had been removed and a discount of 15% also applied however it was a big disappointment after our lovely stay there.üò¢

Review Title: Very comfortable, perfect location, worth the money.
Negative Reviews:
Do not under any circumstances buy their over priced room service food. The price looks reasonable, but you get such little food and it was so bad. I ate it just because I had a deadline and could not leave but I was so hungry. I regret this because it gave me a full on headache for how awful it was. This is also the first hotel ever to charge a delivery fee for room service. ‚Ç¨3 to bring the food from upstairs so just order from Wolt, for better food. 

The bathroom was the worst part of the room to be really honest. The shower had black mould and the bidet which I was happy for leaked. The bidet has a separate switch which I did not understand but hey I was happy for it. The shower pressure was terrible in that room, but that might be okay because the shower barrier only encased half the tub which means that the floor was soaked after each shower.

The luggage storage was very big but anyone could walk in so be careful not to leave anything if value if you arrive too early and have to leave your luggage.

The hotel lobby had dirty carpets when we walked in which I didn‚Äôt mind but since it was the first place guests saw I wondered why they left it like that. They did have someone cleaning the wet snowy floors all
of the time though which was really good.
Positive Reviews:
This hotel is in the best location that you can stay in, in Latvia.

Location: when you cross the river from the airport you get into the main city of Riga. This property is just at the edge of Riga facing the river so that you get a lovely view, and it isn‚Äôt busy. You can really relax here. Then when you leave the hotel, (facing the hotel) directly behind the hotel and to the left is all of the old town. With all the sites you probably came to see. To the right of the hotel is the main bus hub, just a 5 minute walk from the front doors. To the back of the bus hub is the modern city part of Riga. The proximity of the hotel to the old and the new is the best. Also, the bus to Tallin as well as other parts of Latvia comes in at that bus stop. Advice, if you take the bus from the airport, face the river and turn right you will see an underground path to cross the road. Do not walk along the riverside, there is no path to cross the 5 lane roadside.

Facilities: I have stayed in 5 star hotels that had beds that weren‚Äôt as comfortable as this. They should go into the pillow business. I honestly wish I had a picture of the beds. 10/10 for those beds. The hotel might be 2 stars the beds are 5 stars.
You get complimentary bottled water, tea, and coffee and the Wi-Fi is good. They provide slippers, robes, shoe cleaners, shampoo, body wash, soap, cotton for make-up and shower caps. They also have a bidet for the people who wash. The view is really nice of the national library and the frozen river.

Surroundings: Directly behind the hotel is Milda, a nice restaurant with traditional Latvian food. They have vegetarian options so this was amazing. About 4 minutes walk away is a Lido, which is the place to go for a full meal for ‚Ç¨5 for budget travellers. Everything is within walking distance from the hotel.

Staff: The cleaning staff are extremely nice. The reception staff are also nice.

Review Title: Dont go to that hotel if you have small kid
Positive Reviews: The breakfast was good. The room was clean but had huge problem with ventilation. We couldn‚Äôt sleep good at nights. I had the window a little bit open but couldn‚Äôt have it too much open because i have a small baby and afraid he will be cold. It is sad because it is nice hotel. Also, the swimming pool costs too much money for 2 persons. Couldnt go every day. We went only 1 time and the woman was there was really mean! She said no is not allowed to go with the baby, there is many people inside and will be noisy. I assured her that the baby will not make noise. Anyway, she seemed very annoyed, she called the reception, no one answered and after she said ok go inside but if he makes noise i have to take you out. We pay, went in, was only 3 people(not crowded as she said) we were swimming, the baby was happy and excited playing with the water and making excitements noises and she came and she said he has to be quiet (in an angry way). We try not to let our baby been happy and excited because it wasn‚Äôt allowed. He wasn‚Äôt crying, he wasnt yelling, he was just a happy baby! He didnt bother any other guest. It seems in that hotel been happy and excited is not allowed. Dont go to that hotel if you have kids.

Review Title: Nice hotel. Decent location near the old town. Problems with parking and using the pool.
Negative Reviews:
The parking situation was not great. I realize that the hotel is on the edge of the old town and parking is scarce. However, during the first night the receptionist insisted we must park in one of the city's distant "free" parking lots, despite there being several empty "pay to park" spots managed by the hotel right next to the hotel building (they were still empty at 11pm, and a separate receptionist later said she had no idea why I wasn't allowed to park there). During the next night, another receptionist told us that hotel guests should park in a "pay" lot just two blocks away (called "Good Parking" on "Kungu iela"), where we could leave the car overnight for 15EUR (instead of the normal 40EUR nightly rate) if we presented a form we were provided. We approached the parking lot and saw a dozen empty spaces. As we pulled up to the gate, the attendant waved us in. However, as I showed him the form provided by the hotel, his attitude changed and he told us to leave since they were "full". We explained that the hotel sent us, and that the lot had plenty of spaces. He claimed that they were "reserved for someone else", though it seemed pretty clear he didn't want to let us park for the hotel's discounted rate, and would rather see if he could fill the lot at the 40EUR rate. When I called the hotel to ask about their supposed arrangement with that parking lot, they basically told me to try parking somewhere else.

Regarding the pool, they don't allow children after 6pm. We had specifically picked this hotel since they have a pool and our kids wanted to swim after sightseeing during the day. I understand a "no kids after 8pm/9pm" policy, but 6pm seems quite early. Since we spent the day sightseeing (as I expect most visitors would), our kids were unable to use the pool in the evening when we returned to the hotel.
Positive Reviews: The room where we stayed was massive; much bigger than expected. The hotel overall was quite nice, and it was easy enough to get to the heart of the old town.

Review Title: Place is great but my experience not quite so.
Negative Reviews:
Although we had a Deluxe room, my experience wasn't really worth of that name. One night we came back with pretty damp clothes because it has been snowing and the radiators were not working at all. Regardless our need to dry our clothes and shoes, we couldn't get the heating no matter how far we turned the knob. Called the reception and they told me to wait 20 mins for the technician which showed up after TWO HOURS, fiddled with the radiators, and leaving the room with no explanation, not even saying bye. Ok, he might have not spoken english but politeness should be worldwide, nobody has come back to us with any report of what he found, we had to go (AGAIN) ad the reception to ask about what and if he found anything wrong. After all that, nobody gave us a straight answer.
Another unforgivable episode happened during breakfast: we started to bring drinks (you need to do that in trips as it's self service) to our table, so water, juice, coffee, cutlery before go and get the food. While we were just doing that (so there were FULL AND CLEAN glassed and mugs in our table), one waitress clear our table as if we were all done there. Incredible.
Nice stay, but BAD rating from be because of the lack of professionalism and in some case the total absence of it. I'd still like to think that I have been particularly unlucky and that this is not story of everyday.
Positive Reviews: Perfect location, just 2 mins walking from the town center and the airport bus's stop (22). The hotel offer a fairly luxurious experience, especially if you manage to book one of the deluxe room overlooking the river. I read few complaints about the noise from the main road but to be honest it wasn't that bad. Equally I wouldn't book any room lower than the 4th floor, just to be on the safe side and have the best view of the river and the bridge. For the above room I wouldn't not spend anything more than ¬£50/night, it's a nice place but is not worth anything more than that IMO. Top breakfast and SPA facilities, absolutely recommended.

Negative Reviews:
The breakfast on the first day (a Sunday) was a shocking experience. Despite all the strict Latvian Covid rules the place was utterly packed, there was no table to be found. People were literally pushing each other to get to a seat. It was self-service, and people were cuing up, 10 cms from each other, to get to the food, which they then took any which way they could. I did not even attempt to get to the pancake counter, as the waiting time was 10-15 minutes there and you couldn't get through the crowd.
Next morning it was calm, and suddenly they had personnel serving food from behind the counter in the most hygienic possible way. The contrast was unexplainable.
I know one should read the small print at the bottom of the page, but I only found a reference ("surcharge") that the swimming pool was to be used with a surcharge, with extensive searching after the fact that I was asked ‚Ç¨ 26 + ‚Ç¨ 5 (this latter for the bathrobe) for a 90-minute use. It included all the spa elements, but as I really only wanted a good swim, those did not interest me. I chose this hotel because it did have a swimming pool, but even the very kind man at the counter advised me against paying such an insane amount if I only wanted to swim a few laps in it.
I read it that the spa was for a fee, but I had never encountered a hotel that asked for money for the use of the swimming pool from its own desk.
Positive Reviews:
I had a wonderful room with a view of the river and the National Library. The bed was comfortable, the room spacious with a good desk and a nice little table in front of the window. I enjoyed having my own kettle in the room.
The breakfast choice was excellent, also for vegetarians.
The hotel is very near to the centre and the market, so it is a good starting point for discovering the city.

Review Title: No luxury of any sort, but serviceable if the price is right
Negative Reviews: When we visited in July 2024 the hotel was dealing with very large groups which meant that breakfast was a bunfight.  This is not a spacious hotel with attractively designed and spacious communal areas.  The rooms and bathrooms are basic (at the level of a Premier Inn), with few facilities and small TVs with a very limited number of channels.  Although the staff works very hard, the breakfast room is like a university/office canteen and was extremely crowded on all five days we were there.
Positive Reviews: This hotel is well-located in Riga and many rooms have riverside views over the Daugava.  The rooms (at least on the 7th floor) were quiet, and the breakfast buffet was extremely varied with something for everyone.  Although not containing a particularly comfortable bed, the room was clean and serviced regularly.  The staff at the check-in desk was always friendly, polite and helpful.

Communication with staff at check in was awful. We were at the hotel for 4 days and each day it was something different. First day no towels in our room and phone in room not working. So you have to go back to reception to explain and that takes time. Second day they didn‚Äôt clean room, there was no door hanger to put on the door outside. However we went down and tried to explain before we left on a tour for 6 hours. The reception said they would make sure it was done. We returned at around 7pm. The room had not been cleaned. Of course we had to go back downstairs to let them know. We then had to go out for about an hour so they could complete this. Next day we went on a tour and returned later to pack for flight the next day. We were woken during the night at around midnight with noise in the hallway. At 4 am there was a screaming altercation in the hallway with 1/2 naked women in the hallway and this continued till around 6 am. I had to get dressed and go downstairs because the phone was not working to ask reception to call the police. 
This was not a good experience. On checking out later in the morning one of the managers did come over to talk to us and apologize while we were waiting for the taxi to the airport. I hope that they do some staff training to improve. Considering this is classified as a 5 star hotel and has a 5 star rating on the booking.com site. I would expect a higher quality of service to tourists. Would I recommend this hotel. I‚Äôm not sure. They need the tourism so I would hope they really fix some of the staff issues and then figure out better maintenance in the rooms.

When we opened the door of our room, it was freezing cold because the window was left open by the cleaner for an entire day. The temperature was below 0 outside, so nearly the same was inside. We couldn't find any radiator to heat up the room, but it was essential considering we had a toddler with us.

The air conditioner was not working as a heater. And there was a note which said that a radiator must be used in the winter season instead. We searched everywhere but there was no radiator in the room. We ended up wearing our winter jackets the entire evening.

Also, the room was booked for 2 adults and 1 toddler. For some reason, they forgot to make up the bed for the little one. So we had to call reception, asking for extra bedsheets etc.

3) However staff was helpful, it's not the best place for families with small kids. Not very comfortable for pram, someone needs to hold doors for you. Obviously for disabled persons it will also be challenging.
4) Breakfast was okay and even quite fulfilling but I didn't enjoy pretty dark lightning, in the morning you expect smth brighter.

Natalja and Elvins at the reception desk were very helpful, thanks.

our room smelled like somebody smoked in it
Positive Reviews: friendly staff

Negative Reviews:
When checking in I was given a key, and as I went to unlock the room, It appeared that there is someone LIVING there already. When opened the door, I met a very shocked, half-dressed man staring at me and running towards the door. It was very embarrassing for me, as the man that I met got very unpleasantly surprised. I felt so terrible, as I invaded his privacy.  :(
Both of us had the same room number written on our cards. I felt very ashamed and distressed.
Tired after the 8-hour flight, I went back to the reception to change the room cards but didn't receive even ONE APOLOGY regards the issue. It felt very unwelcoming and disrespectful. Like if what I just experienced wasn't taken seriously.
I was moved to the other block of the hotel, which seemed not so well kept, as the elevator was dirty. The receptionist gave me the card and asked in a rude voice: "Do you want me to show you where is the other entrance?" I asked her to do it as I had no idea where to go.
She walked me to the other door, unlocked it, and left. I went up to my room. Everything seemed ok, but I must say that the sound isolation wasn't proper, as I could hear people talking/laughing when passing my door at night. You could hear people coming back from parties in the inner yard as well (the window was shut). The room didn't have complimentary drinking water as you might expect. And unfortunately, there was mold, a bit of hair, and red nail polish marks in the bathtub.

After paying 118Eur for one night I must say that the experience was so unpleasant, that I have decided not to stay in the Wellton Riverside hotel again.. this was the first and last time
I've stayed in various locations in Europe and the Middle East alone and with my spouse when traveling for work or leisure, but I had never experienced anything similar in any 4 or 5-star hotel.
Positive Reviews:
The location of the hotel is very good. You can reach all the sightseeing points in Riga by walking. 
For breakfast, there are many options for vegetarians and vegans, also pancakes and waffle stations, and you can get freshly baked eggs. As I was expecting, on Saturday the breakfast hall was full, but luckily the staff offered to have a meal in the lounge bar area. 

I must say that I'm not picky or have insanely high expectations, but unfortunately, I didn't feel that the money's worth was met..

Review Title: Great location, nice room, but odd policies detract from the overall experience
Negative Reviews:
For a hotel of this class, some of the policies were a little...odd.

For instance the air conditioning is turned off from September onwards. I get that this makes sense in the dead of winter when it's unlikely to be needed, but when it's September and actually still quite warm (24 degrees with the heating turned off according to the thermostat) it's not the most comfortable. 

Especially when this means you then have to open up the windows to let the cool air - and all the traffic noise - in. And being right by a busy road, with the windows open there was quite a lot of traffic noise.

The other slightly odd thing was that as guests of the hotel - a spa hotel - you were expected to pay for entry to the spa. I get that massages and treatments would be extra, that's normal, but most spa hotels I've stayed in offer free entry to guests. Here it was ‚Ç¨18 for 90 mins, or ‚Ç¨10 if you had a treatment. So if as a couple you want to spend a relaxing few hours in the spa, the costs could quickly mount up.

With these policies it just seemed a bit 'Ryanair' if that makes sense...which I get if that's the target market you're going for: low-cost, no-frills, basic and budget - but I don't think that actually is the market it's aimed at, so it seems a bit incongruous. Things you might take for granted aren't available or are extra.
Positive Reviews:
The hotel location was amazing, perfectly positioned by the river and the old town so that all the major destinations were just a short walk away.

The room itself was nice; nice bathroom (with a bath!) and comfortable enough (I'm never a huge fan of the "stick twin beds together with a mattress topper on top" approach, but it's pretty de rigueur these days) - the room itself was very clean and modern.

Review Title: Take care of your guests before, not after they start complaining
Negative Reviews:
1. Not sure if it's hote's or booking's problem, but our 9 year old child was not counted as a guest, and even though we booked a room with two beds for 2 adults and 1 child (9 years old) the booking confirmation stated there will be two guests, and hotel made a big deal out of that. At the end of the day the issue has been solved and did not cost anything in addition, the experience was not plesent.
2. There was a problem with electricity one evening - it just got gone in an entire floor for about 2-3 hours. While it is understandable such things may happen sometimes, 32 degrees outside, no electricity, no air conditioning, no ability to take a shower or charge a phone/laptop is not something you can just leave your guests with, even if you're trying to fix the problem. Offering your guests a clod drink or sending them to spa to keep them busy while the issue is resolved is what a really good hotel would do. Not this one unfortunately.
Positive Reviews: Location is great, parkin lot, even though separately paid, is very close to the hotel, really good breakfast and clean room, comfy beds. Staff is mostly helpful, not always.

Review Title: Location is good and rooms are nice but breakfast is below 4-star bar
Negative Reviews:
There were no towels in one of our rooms but after we asked about it they solved the problem. In one room the batteries of the door were empty and we weren't able to enter but they solved the problem. It seems that answering the reception phone is not a priority - we called 3-4 times before administrator answered the phone. Hotel staff (beside reception administrators) do not understand English. As an example, we went a a bit early to the spa area (which by the way is not included in the room price). The gym was open but other rooms were dark. There were no sign about opening time and when we asked about it from one employee, he just guided us to the elevator which seemed strange. We got the information when we asked in Russian. There were other situations when English wasn't enough. 

Breakfast was disappointing from the start. First there were no forks, when we asked about it, first employee just turned her back on us and walked away. At first we thought that she went to bring forks, but after a few minutes we understand that it wasn't the case. So we asked from another employee and she helped us. The selection of food weren't exactly bad but where it lacks was the quality. Maybe it was a bad day in the kitchen, but the general level of the breakfast was below 4-star bar. If breakfast is one of your criteria then Hampton by Hilton or Radisson would be a better choice.
Positive Reviews: Location is good. Rooms are pretty nice, quiet and clean. Bed is also ok. Hotel reception is helpful. There were some issues with parking, but no big deal. Check-in process was slower than I've experienced with other similar rating hotels but no big deal. The Check-out process was ok.

Negative Reviews: The room The hotel room is not worth the price. This time we were put far away from our friends. To a new building, which was rather an old building in its nature and appearance. The hotel room was much worse than a year ago when staying in an old building for the same money. The view from the hotel room is non-existent, against a dingy building. You can't keep the window open at night, because the street is too noisy, all the drunk people. But you can't keep it closed either, because otherwise there will be no air in the room, because the air conditioner will no longer work in September. It should work, then the window could be closed. Didn't like the bathroom. Compared to the room in the old building, it's like a night and day. There is nowhere to put things because there is no desk space next to the sink. The closet in the room is large and clunky with open shelves, which is not nice. Absolutely did not like the room this time! For this money, you should get a more normal room. Why is there such a drastic difference between the rooms of the same class in the old building and the new building? The price should be much lower for those "new building" rooms. And breakfast is served separately in different buildings. On the first morning, we went to the main house, where the choice of food was larger and different foods were also offered. The second morning we were no longer allowed there, but had to eat in our building, where the selection was smaller and some foods were not available at all. Why? Because I have paid the same amount of money, but the food I got was worse. Not satisfied with this arrangement at all. Other friends got much better rooms and a better breakfast in the "old building" for the same price.

Review Title: Its real shame. I can‚Äôt believe you can do that to your clients every day.
Negative Reviews:
I have not received what I was expecting to receive. I was booking hotel just because it was a SPA hotel and I was very disappointed to know that my booking does not include SPA access. 

You offer of rooms which are "with" and "without" access to the SPA are not clear to most of the people! 
You have so many hotel room types and packages, people are not able to scroll all the way down to find that some rooms are with SPA access.
Here I made a video of how it looks https://photos.app.goo.gl/f6XtMtYAwXfqAktZ9

Saying that this room is ‚Äúwithout‚Äù is more important than saying that other room is ‚Äúwith‚Äù.
If I would know that I will not have it for the price I booked a hotel, I would book myself to another hotel. 
Normal people expect to have access to SPA if they order stay in SPA hotel and if some of the rooms does not have it, you should specify rather those that are without, than those that are with. :))) Otherwise, it looks like cheating. 

Furthermore, I was disappointed twice. When next morning I informed to reception about my bad experience I met understandings and receptionist informed me that she can make SPA for us despite we have another package. When I went to inform that to my partner, and we came back I have been notified that hotel manager didn‚Äôt allow to do so but you are ready to give 30% discount from your regular rate and that supposed to be good offer for us :))) Of course it was double failure then... Besides even difference in rate between room with SPA and without was even smaller that the price I was asked. 
Its real shame. I can‚Äôt believe you can do that to your clients every day.

Negative Reviews:
At our arrival on Saturday morning, the man at the reception told us our room was already free but it needed cleaning. He apologized that the hotel was fully booked and couldn't give us a room straight ahead. We came back after 11 as he told us, and there was a different person at the reception who said several rooms are already available but you have to pay extra for an early check-in. Otherwise come back in an hour. I told her that her colleague did not mention any extra money, and that he was going to give us a room straight away, but it needed cleaning. I felt like she was making fun of us and was taking satisfaction out of our tiredness. My partner said let's go and walk for one more hour, but I was too tired. I paid the extra 20‚Ç¨ cause I just wanted to rest.
The following day, I asked about the tourist bus and got false information. They wanted to sell 25‚Ç¨ tickets for only 24h and said the next bus was at 12:15, and that there were only 4 red busses a day. We walked for literally 2 minutes and saw the red bus ready to leave (11:30), and the ticket was 20‚Ç¨ per person, available for 48 hours! Unbelievable. Do not buy your tourist bus tickets with them, it's a rip off. 
In the room, it was not a king size bed, but two individual beds stuck together, with two different blankets. So I didn't feel like I was sleeping with my partner.
Disappointing breakfast, 0 vegan options (on request i did have several vegan products on the second morning: vegan cheese, bread, yogurt, apple cake). Almost no fresh fruits. Plastic glasses for the juice (which by the way is horrible). Huge canteen with way too many people. 
Do not recommend at all.

while we checking in, receptionist told us that we can‚Äôt park our car to their park area because it‚Äôs already full. however, it wasn‚Äôt full, or booked. because during the time we‚Äôve spent there parking area always empty, nobody used it. they wanted us to park at another parking area which is not their place, I believe guys on the reception or the hotel management has an agreement with that parking area and they provide them extra customer. requesting a customer to park their car outside the hotel‚Äôs parking area and walk back in that freezing weather is cruel and unethical, especially when they have space. 
also when we enter the room, there were only one bed (two single beds were combined) even though we have booked the room with two beds. it was very uncomfortable and very small. when we requested them to change the room, they denied it because they didn‚Äôt have available room. they should‚Äôve stated that on the booking.com, that option should‚Äôve been unavailable. 
anyway, this was my second time in there and I was planning to stay there regularly during my future business trips. I‚Äôll continue with other hotels.

Review Title: Too expensive for such an average experience
Negative Reviews:
Reception staff was understaffed (long queues and waiting time) and out of 3 receptionists I talked to in 2 days, 1 was friendly. I had to run downstairs 3x the first night and 1x second one because the door keys didn't work or stopped working. 
In the mornings a baby crying and a dog barking next door kept waking me up- you can hear pretty well through the walls/doors. Breakfast for this price is low quality- coffee doesn't have any taste or smell. I would think for a such a large hotel ,especially when they tell you they are fully booked, they would have a higher quality service. View is the worst - from one side damaged buildings, the other one a closed street. Even though we put up a do not disturb sign, the cleaning staff put on another one stating that they couldn't get in our room while we were away which was weird- they are not supposed to go in?
Positive Reviews: They have a decent spa and I received a great massage. They have a gym too. Located in the city center (almost). They provided board games and robes in the room which I asked for.

Review Title: I am very disappointed with the staff, they are the managers,they do not respect their client at all
Negative Reviews: Only the location is great, but this hotel disappointed me a lot, the staff, that is the managers, do not respect their client at all, the attitude towards the hotel guests is tragic. Our story is as follows: We arrived by booking a room for the whole family in advance 2 + 2. Since we wanted a spa we had to book in advance and that, well we chose a 4 star hotel with a spa. When we arrived in the room, we saw that there was no shampoo or shower gel, well ok-there is soap, somehow we would get away. There is also no drinking water, only 1 bottle of still water in the mini bar, and we are a family of 4, somehow I did not expect to have to bring a 5 liter bottle of drinking water to the 4-star hotel. The image with the bottle in hand would look somehow uncomfortable ??? As we got ready for the spa, we saw that there were no bathrobes. Then we contacted the reception that we needed bathrobes and shampoo, at the reception I was simply arrogantly called by the manager that we needed to charge a more expensive number, but we paid 345 euros. what more expensive room to take, maybe the president ??? I am very disappointed and I will never recommend this hotel to anyone.
Positive Reviews: The only thing that is good with this hotel is the location :) The whole old town can be reached on foot in a few minutes.The great location allows you to visit all the famous places in the old town.

Negative Reviews: SPA was not included in room price, had to pay 2x more comparing to room price to have a swim with two children.
Positive Reviews: I liked room, breakfast was fine too. Located in Old Town.

Negative Reviews: It was lockdowm
Positive Reviews: It was lockdown

Review Title: I don't think we will ever stay in this hotel...
Negative Reviews:
Unfortunately our stay in this hotel was very disappointing from the first minute of booking. The staff couldn't normally say about spa rules and help to book time. I was trying to do that two days and I couldn't. When we came - it appeared that there are now available places... Yes, I understand the Covid  situation there can be just the limit number of people but still - there should be clear information how you have to book it, especially when I wrote them many times and even called. 
Breakfast - it seems that they care so much  about Covid only in SPA...Breakfast place was crowded!!!So hotel will take care about your stomach. but not about mental and physical health...You can eat as much as you want and when you want, but you can not swim in the pool....at all....And the breakfast itself was not the best and the restaurant is not very cozy :(
Positive Reviews:
NOTHING. 
Despite of mixing the keys of our rooms - they are ok. Except very interesting thing - the hotel has a spa but they don't have the robes in the rooms... 
In some situations even staff itself was surprised about their answers to our questions about some things in their hotel.. ;););) So this comical situation helped not to get mad about everything else...

Negative Reviews: Slow check in, old furniture room, smoked in the  room, low shower pressure.

Review Title: One of the worst hotels I ever stayed in !
Negative Reviews:
Rude staff from day one ! After checking in I came back to reception to ask for plug converter , and reception lady actually shouted at me infornt of strange people if I can't see that she's busy and told me to wait in que and there was maybe 15 people at that moment ...
next thing was the fact they didn't accept our COVID recovery certificates from UK , the hotel page didn't mention about some
Latvian form with Qr codes of recovery certificates , they didn't accept our PCR test which is last for 72 hrs, made day before checking in hotel , and for that reason we we couldn't use any hotel facilities like spa , swimming pool or even dining area where swimming pool was actually reason why we choose this hotel . Because we wasn't allowed to restaurant we had to go every day with the list of what they should bring for breakfast to our room , every day we was waiting about 40 min for breakfast delivery , and food was just cold and burned , there was family of four but they never bring enough amount of plates , kettlery or even food , always missing something and picture I'm attaching is a proof for that . I have to mention that for extra cost we ordered dinner from hotel kitchen , chicken strips was made of frozen meet and actually we couldn't cut it even with knife not mentioning that it was impossible to chew , duck was dry and my partner pasta without no taste all for cost of 45‚Ç¨, room service support bring me 5‚Ç¨ change but they didn't when I mentioned that on next day they say they can't remember and they didn't have any note about any change ....
Room service ... the stinky ladies who didn't clean the room
Properly , they left the old dirty Dishes fromPrevious day on place where we left them while leaving the room , towels been change just once in our 5 days stay !

DON NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL !!!
Positive Reviews: Completely nothing

Negative Reviews: It was awful. We didnt get our room on time. We were with kid. The personal in front desk were rude. They didnt say sorry for waiting, we wait until 15:30 and the room wasnt ready (there were people still there), so we left hotel and went to the city. I pay money for the time I could spend in the hotel room. After all in the room we found some pieces of glass, happy that kid didnt get into.

Review Title: You get better choices for the money spent in the area
Negative Reviews: The staff seems to be on the rude and slow side. Very slow check in. You need to know that the hotel has two buidlings, one at the streetside (or riverside, how they call it), and one in the back, which does offer parking space and house views. Make sure you are booking the right room if you want river view or Pool (and/or SPA) - it seems to be a common misunderstanding - and therefore totally not undestandable by both, the hotel and booking.com - that Pool (SPA) is NOT included in the base room rates, and costs a fairly high extra price PER DAY.
Positive Reviews: As a very experienced traveller I believe I can judge well the differences between a good or not so good hotel. Overall, the Wellton Riverside was a very mixed experiences hotel. My biggest compliments go to the Breakfast Manager Anzela who responded very professionally, quickly and friendly to our special requests. Also, the beds were surprisingly comfortable, and made up for the many other issues. Locationwise, it is a nice walk to the old town and straight at the river (but there is a huge road before it).

Negative Reviews: Very inconvenient parking "system" and we booked this hotel because of the spa, only to find out it's accessible for extra charge and also breakfast wasn't included (tho we planned to eat out anyway).

We stayed here for 4 nights, 3 adults, our first time in Riga and had a wonderfull stay. The staff was very friendly and at the resception got a lot of very nice and usefull advices for sightseeing of the city. We would gladly book here again!
